situation: R was overwhelmed when the planned school assembly was unexpectedly canceled, and all students were sent back to their classrooms.
action: The teacher told R to 'deal with it,' and redirected focus to the lesson without providing any support to adjust to the schedule change.
effect: R's inability to process the abrupt change led to increased fidgeting and a lack of concentration for the entire lesson. She needed more time than usual to settle down afterward.
topic: Routine Disruptions - Changes in daily schedule or expected activities
